title: Nuget Reference
description: Add a nuget reference to a .NET project

project.description: The project to which the reference is added.
project.x-prompt: What project should the package be added to?

framework.description: Adds a package reference only when targeting a specific framework.

packageDirectory.description: The directory where to restore the packages. The default package restore location is %userprofile%\.nuget\packages on Windows and ~/.nuget/packages on macOS and Linux. For more information, see  [Managing the global packages, cache, and temp folders in NuGet](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/consume-packages/managing-the-global-packages-and-cache-folders).

prerelease.description: Allows prerelease packages to be installed. Available since .NET Core 5 SDK

source.description: The URI of the NuGet package source to use during the restore operation.

noRestore.description: Adds a package reference without performing a restore preview and compatibility check.

allowVersionMismatch.description: Ignores single version principle for this package across all apps in the workspace
